Given me a $10 coupon to make up for the extra money I had to spend reordering a book that I had placed an order for back in February. I had money left in the e-wallet when I ordered an item on sale. I was going to have the item shipped to my son’s school to avoid shipping charges. When I contacted customer service last week, I was told that my order had expired because my son’s teacher had not submitted the order. He had not been notified that I had ordered anything, and he had submitted an order later in February but my order must have already expired because he did not see it. I was frustrated with scholastic for this whole process. The money from the e-wallet disappeared after the order I placed in February, and I did not get that credit back when my order was cancelled. So instead of paying $11.56 for the order like I would have done in February, I ended up paying over $21 due to shipping and not being given the sale price. Instead I was given a coupon code for a free $5 book and told that I would be refunded my shipping once I receive the order. It just seems like a headache and a lot of hoops to jump through when someone maybe could have just given me $10 off in the beginning rather than giving me an extra book that I didn’t really want. I would have much rather paid less and just received the one book I had originally ordered.

the idea of "auto submitting" is stupid.  The rep I spoke too couldn't give me spceifics about how much time passes until an order is "auto submitted."  I give my families one week to get orders in.  It has been 4 days since the first order and it was "auto submitted." I was told if more parents order before my due date of tomorrow then I will have to call and have their orders added to avoid shipping fees--are you kidding me? So form now on this is how you are operating? I generate thousands for you each year and I will not function this way next year.  I understand that some teachers might forget, so having an order be submitted after a warning email and no response is a great idea.  THis is a huge headache and dumb.  I was going to use my $10 coupon from April and now this makes it much harder.  I WILL  NOT spend my plan time revising and adding to orders.  DUMB.

Autosubmit is a TERRIBLE feature. You submitted my order, before I was ready, not allowing me to take full advantage of my ordering points/promotions. After last years shipping debacle, teachers are already hesitant to come back to Scholastic. This will be the final strike for many teachers. Your staff explained the feature, but now I have to call and argue about promotions when the rest of my orders come in.  Get it together and consult some teachers before you start new features like this.
They said it was too hard to figure out via chat and that I'd need to call.

It was solved because I had another parent place an online order so I will not have the shipping fee now. However, I am still not sure why the order placed by another parent was automatically submitted without my consent. I hope that is not the future plan for Scholastic or I will not be placing orders. It affects being able to add up totals to gain incentives, bonus points, and free shipping.
Explained a change in policy BEFORE I had to call. I have none.

First off, please know that this was not the representative's fault and my displeasure has nothing to do with the chat. I started a chat to ask why two of my online student orders were submitted automatically without my knowledge. I had orders to add to the two online orders and had wanted to add some things on my own for my classroom and use up some bonus points. The order was just a few dollars away from the next level of bonus points, too. I am very frustrated with this process and not knowing it was going to happen. If I knew I would have added everything in to get the most out of the order. I was told that I could contact Scholastic once a new order is placed and combine it and get reimbursed for orders under $25 if applicable. This is a lot more work than necessary and just adds more to do from a teacher's end. The process used to be smooth and easy and now it is not. I had been a loyal customer for almost 20 years. I took a year off because after COVID it was a nightmare to order and process with Scholastic. Books took forever to come and many orders were incorrect. Some books never came and it was time consuming to rectify everything that went wrong. I missed the excitement of my students getting books, however, and several colleagues said things had gotten better, so I decided to give it try with this current class. Everything was great until this current order. Unfortunately, I will not continue to order if the automatic submissions cannot be turned off. I don't have the extra time to contact Scholastic to merge multiple orders or to get reimbursement if needed. There were many more "perks" in the past and the ease of online ordering and being able to add student and personal orders before submitting was awesome.
Excellent assistance.

Scholastic for some reason now "Auto-submits" orders. I was not aware of this and my due date for my order is May 5. I have a lot of items in my teacher cart that I used with bonus points that now I will be charged shipping if I order. GET RID OF AUTO-SUBMIT.  The first agent was rude, second agent I talked to was nice. Disappointed.

Please do NOT auto submit my book order Please do not auto submit book orders.  I had set a due date for my families and then my order was auto submitted but I hadn't placed my teacher order yet. I now will have take time to call, as well as have multiple shipments to track and hand out. I would recommend not auto-submitting in the future.

I am very upset with the direction Scholastic seems to be going in.  You no longer offer 1.00 books like we used to have access to.  Teachers would use these one dollar books to give as gifts to their students at Christmas and the end of the year.  Now they are few and far between which is very disappointing.  You have raised them 100% ...to 2 dollars.  ALSO ... I just placed a 123.00 order in April.  I see that I will no longer get my 10.00 of free books this month like in the past...now you give a coupon for 10.oo for a May order.  I am not getting book orders every single month!!  Are you guys really that clueless on how the economy is going right now.  Teachers are not sending book orders home every month because we know that would be tone deaf with the way people are struggling financially lately.  Since I will not ask parents to spend more money in MAY after they just spent 123.00 in April....that basically means my 10.00 that I earned this month will not be used!!!   You all know that....which is why you did it.  You are saving yourselves the money that we earned.   I am very disappointed in the direction Scholastic is going. Very!!

Putting in orders today for EL students whose parents can't do it - I could not enter the "free book" promo on the flyer, it would not let me. A student spending 45 dollars couldn't get her free book for 5 dollars. Contacted chat help. They said only parents could do this. Strike one. I had 10 dollars off next order in May, not now, school is over mid May, that does nothing for me now. Strike two. I realized having 2 coupons - put them in - both expired. Strike 3. Teachers get busy, when orders get big, coupons are forgotten for "next months order". Don't do this. Make the coupons now, when they are earned. It is a tech world yes, but title one schools with parents who have either no money, or can't fill out a form or do it online - still need teacher's help. I appreciate VERY much the chat help gave me the 10 dollars off code now, got the 2 5 dollar books the students needed. Overall chat today - good job. Overall coupon and discount experience, needs improving. Just the comments in the previous comment box. I've been with Scholastic for over 20 years. Keep it teacher-real. Thanks!
